TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed GreatCircle extends System.Object

Docs.summary: This class provides some basic geodetic calculations on the WGS84 ellipsoid. This returns exact distances between two points, considering the non-spherical shape of the earth. The results are accurate for distances greater than about 1cm.

Docs.summary: Calculate the difference between two angles, return degrees.

Public Shared Function AviaticToRadians (val As Double) As Double
static member AviaticToRadians : double -> double

Docs.summary: Converts an angle in aviatic definition to mathematic definition. Aviatic angles are in degrees, where 0 degrees is north, counting clockwise, mathematic angles are in radians, starting east and going counterclockwise.

Docs.summary: Calculate the velocity towards (or away from) the target. This is often also called VMG (=Velocity made good)
Docs.returns: Speed towards target. Negative if moving away from target

.method public static hidebysig void CrossTrackError(class Iot.Device.Common.GeographicPosition origin, class Iot.Device.Common.GeographicPosition destination, class Iot.Device.Common.GeographicPosition currentPosition, [out] valuetype UnitsNet.Length& crossTrackError, [out] valuetype UnitsNet.Length& distanceTogoAlongRoute) cil managed

Docs.param: The distance perpendicular to the leg. Positive if the current position is to the right of the leg.
Distance to go on track (with current position projected back to the leg)
Docs.summary: Computes cross-track error, that is the distance the current position is away from the route from origin to destination
Docs.remarks: Accuracy may be limited for distances > 100km

Docs.param: Great circle distance between the positions
Initial direction to travel, in degrees true
Docs.summary: Returns the distance and direction between two points on the globe
Docs.remarks: The distance and direction are calculated for the great circle. That is the shortest distance between two points on the globe. This path does not follow a constant direction (for large distances)

Docs.param: Great circle distance between the positions
Initial direction to travel, in degrees true
Angle in which the voyage should start. True angle in which the direction lies when standing at the start position.
Docs.summary: Returns the distance and direction between two points on the globe
Docs.remarks: This path does not follow a constant direction (for large distances)

Docs.param: Distance between points, on the great circle, in meters.
Angle in which the voyage should start. True angle in which the direction lies when standing at the start position.
Docs.summary: Returns the distance and direction between two points on the globe
Docs.remarks: This path does not follow a constant direction (for large distances). Prefer using the method instead, to avoid errors from exchanged parameters or wrong units
